plugins.name: Viewport Size Calculator
plugins.description:
Looking for an easier way to design for different screen sizes and devices? Look no further than the Viewport Area Calculator plugin! This powerful tool is perfect for designers and developers who want to optimize their websites quickly and accurately, all within the Figma design environment.


With the Viewport Size Calculator, you'll get a range of helpful features that make the design process smoother and more efficient. You can select the operating system, browser, and theme, and the plugin will factor in the dimensions of those interface elements to calculate the appropriate viewport size. Plus, you can specify whether the page content was scrolled or not for even more precise calculations.


Whether you're designing for mobile or desktop, the Viewport Size Calculator makes it easy to optimize your website for the best user experience. And as part of the Figma ecosystem, it's designed to work seamlessly with other plugins and features, making it a breeze to integrate into your existing design workflow.


Ready to take your design process to the next level? Try out the Viewport Size Calculator today and start designing with confidence, all within the Figma environment.
plugins.tagline: helping designers to understand how their pages will be to the users

plugins.name: Figma to Streamlit
plugins.description:
A plugin to generate st. commands with their corresponding parameters and values, based on the components from our existing Figma Design System.


How to use it:

This plugin is complementary to our official Design System library, so make sure you grab a copy of it as well.

  1. After you’ve copied our design system file, select a component instance, and tweak any of its props and values
  2. Then run the plugin, and hit See my code to get a code snippet you can use in your Streamlit app!


If you need more help, check out our repository, which contains more thorough details and video examples.


Troubleshooting

If you hit any errors while using the plugin, make sure you check our troubleshooting guide in our repo, and if you’re still experiencing setbacks, file an issue and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can!Also, here are a few more resources that might be helpful for you:

  • Our Design System launch blog post, with instructions on how to use it;
  • This plugin's repository, containing the code for it, and video instructions on how to use it.


Have fun with it!

plugins.name: Progress ThemeBuilder
plugins.description:
Discover Progress ThemeBuilder, the cutting-edge Figma plugin that redefines how designers create themes for Telerik and Kendo UI web components. With this powerful tool, you can effortlessly bridge the gap between design and development, streamline your workflow, and even export HTML directly from Figma and map it to existing components, delivering polished themes and design systems faster than ever before.


Figma to HTML Made Simple

Seamlessly convert your Figma designs into fully functional HTML. ThemeBuilder automates the generation of HTML and SASS/CSS variables, including colors, typography, and other design tokens, directly from your Figma design files. This eliminates manual coding, ensuring consistency and efficiency throughout the design-to-development pipeline.


Support for Figma Variables

Progress ThemeBuilder takes full advantage of Figma’s variables, enabling you to work with colors, numbers, and other properties to create dynamic and adaptable designs. Whether you're working with light or dark mode, ThemeBuilder ensures your designs are flexible and user-centric.


Why Choose Progress ThemeBuilder

Progress ThemeBuilder empowers designers and developers to work smarter, not harder. By converting your Figma designs directly into HTML, it eliminates the need for tedious manual coding, reduces errors, and speeds up the time to market.


Learn more and experience the power of Progress ThemeBuilder on our product page. Start transforming your design process today!

plugins.name: Colors Styles Switcher
plugins.description:
We Encourage Utilize the new Variables features instead of this plugin. for more information visit Figma Variables


Switch between your color palettes. This plug-in provides you with a simple way to switch between your themes.


How it works

When you add a new theme, all color styles and their properties, including the names and color values, are copied to the new theme, and any modifications made to the color styles are mirrored in the selected theme. As a result, each theme has a duplicate of your color styles with different color values. When you switch themes, the current theme will translate its own color values into Figma color styles, affecting any artboards that use your color styles.


Step by Step Guide

1. Add a new theme, and all your color styles from Figma will be copied to the new theme.

2. Repeat step number 1, but this time, feel free to change any color style via Figma to what fits your design.

3. Toggle between themes, the values of the color styles will change depending on the one you select.

plugins.name: Image Wrap
plugins.description:
Image Wrapper allows you to use shapes as masks. Quickly.


To use it, simply:

  1. Select any Frame, Shape or Text in Figma.
  2. Drag and Drop an image onto the plugin.


Image Wrapper supports 2 operating modes:


“Use selection as mask”

The plugin will automatically create a mask group and insert the image, taking care of any resizing necessary.


“Fill selection with image"

This is the same as manually creating an Image Paint in the properties panel, except it’s much faster.

plugins.name: BendType
plugins.description:
BendType is a Figma plugin that lets you seamlessly transform any text layer into beautifully curved text. With intuitive controls for Bend and Rotate, you can easily create smooth, precise arcs that maintain optimal letter spacing.


Whether you’re designing logos, posters, or any creative projects that call for dynamic text effects, Curved Text Maker offers complete control. The plugin replaces your original text layer with an accurately centered curved version, ensuring your design stays perfectly aligned. Enjoy features such as:


  1. Accurate Letter Spacing: Automatically adjusts spacing for characters of all widths.
  2. Flexible Bend & Rotation: Use the Bend slider to create curves from subtle arcs to full circles, and the Rotate slider (enabled only when Bend is active) to fine-tune the orientation.
  3. Seamless Integration: The curved text replaces your original text layer, keeping your layout intact while offering creative flexibility.


Elevate your typography with precision and ease — create stunning, curved text designs in seconds with BendType.

plugins.name: Import Google Sheets (For Variables)
plugins.description:
Import Google Sheets (For Variables)


A plugin that allows you to import Google Sheets into a Figma collection (variables). Supports synchronization to multiple modes, not just single mode.


View the code on GitHub


Google Sheets API


https://sheets.googleapis.com/v4/spreadsheets/${SHEET_ID}/values/${RANGE}?key=${TOKEN}


To create an API URL


  1. open the Google Sheets you want to synchronize with Figma.
  2. click the "Share" button in the top right corner, and select "Everyone with the link" from the general access.
  3. Get the ${SHEET_ID} of the Google Sheets link in your browser's address bar.
  4. Set ${TOKEN} by issuing an authorization token in Google Cloud Manager settings. (https://admin.google.com)
  5. Set the scope for the rest of the data except for the columns (e.g. A2:D).
  6. set ${RANGE} to a string that is the sum of the sheet name and the above range.


Sample URL


https://sheets.googleapis.com/v4/spreadsheets/1iYOtMl4nqwtEgBWq4_B0EcIoSB5bc77OOhPzsm79nIc/values/Sheet1!A2:D?key=AIzaSyA5xA59tkljcFItKX3JDhJ6Dr-Ng8_PmVk


Set up the rest


  1. Enter a name for the collection. If the collection exists, delete it and add it again.
  2. Except for the variable names, describe the modes (columns) separated by commas.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize from Google Sheets to Figma Variables (i18n messages, other properties, etc)

plugins.name: Figma To Roblox
plugins.description:
Export your Figma designs to Roblox


Simple usage:

  1. Run Figma to Roblox
  2. Select the item(s) you wish to export
  3. Click 'Convert Selection'
  4. Download the rbxmx file and import into roblox!


Simple usage (video)


Usage with Images:

  1. Run Figma to Roblox
  2. Navigate to your Credentials
  3. (Step 1) Create a new Api Key (via the 'CREATE API KEY' button)
  4. (Step 2) Give the api key 'Assets API' permission
  5. (Step 3) If you are using my servers as a proxy (default), while it isn't recommended, add `0.0.0.0/0` to the list (since my servers have several different ips, and use cloudflare it'd ruin the inconvenience of this plugin). Optionally, if you're hosting your own proxy just enter your own ip.
  6. Now that you've got an api key, copy and paste it into the 'Cloud API Key' field in the FTR ui (Remember to enter your userid into the 'User ID' field!)
  7. Enable 'Upload Images' (Optionally you can enable 'Export Images' which will export all images and zip them)
  8. Finally, click 'Convert Selection' and wait until you either see a prompt to download or an error pops up
  9. Go into roblox, select 'Import from File' and select the file you just download!


Example usage (video)


To export an element (or a group) make an export setting with the suffix 'EI' (only supports PNG and JPG formats) example


Feel free to suggest updates or report bugs to me:

NoTwistedHere#6703 on Discord

Github repo
plugins.tagline: For the developer who cares

73169.release_notes:
- Added a method for easily importing Images to Roblox
1. Upload the images to your Roblox game. You should see them all in the Asset Manager.
2. Upload the Images to Figma and we will want to add them as custom local styles.
2.1. Click the Icon on the Fill property
2.2. Click the New Variable + button
2.3. Swap from Variable to Style
2.4 Set the Description to the ID of your Image in your Roblox game. It does NOT need to be prefixxed with "rbxassetid://", but it can be.

[Image guide](https://i.imgur.com/cduqTbD.png)

Your Image Labels will now have the Image property set to the ID whenever this Style is used. (Make sure to use the style, rather than reuploading the image.)

plugins.name: Monday Hero
plugins.description:
Convert design to code in minutes!

Export code of designed UI, save time by removing repetitive manual work in the UI, and focus on the functionality more. It's free to start and try it out!


Key Functions Loved by Developers & Teams:

  • Turn Figma Designs into Reusable Code: Easily convert to Swift (iOS projects with UI/Layout support including Storyboard, Xib), Flutter (iOS, Android, Web projects). You can convert your Swift and Flutter projects to React, React Native, Kotlin, SwiftUI and more development languages using Hero AI Assistant.
  • Hero AI Assistant: Use pre-ready prompts to add functionalities, fix bugs, convert code into different programming languages, and ensure responsive, adaptable output.
  • Export responsive code, source-code, assets (PNG, PDF, SVG), fonts, and colors.
  • Build UI for iOS native applications using XIB and programming-style components. Include list view builders, texts, custom widgets, card views, buttons, text fields, and more.
  • Manage colors, text styles, and images (renaming) efficiently.
  • Automatically create guidelines.
  • Flexible Project Integration: Export designs as a new project, into an existing project, or select specific screens only.
  • Enhanced Collaboration: Work independently or in an all-in-one place with your team.


Download the Monday Hero app, use the Monday Hero Plugin to import your designs, and start working on your developer-friendly code!

Download here: https://mondayhero.io/download/

Read the docs: https://learn.mondayhero.io/

For more information: https://mondayhero.io/

plugins.name: Detach Selected Instances
plugins.description:
Detach all instances in the selected objects.

They include child and grandchild objects.


How to use

  1. Select all the objects you want to "Detach Instance".
  2. Execute this plugin.


Notice

  • Components cannot be detached.
  • This operation is the same as the following.
  1. Ctrl + Alt + B / Option + Command + B ("Detach Instance")
  2. Enter (Select all child objects)
  3. Ctrl + Alt + B / Option + Command + B ("Detach Instance")

　　…

=============================================


選択した要素内にあるインスタンスを全て解除します。

選択した要素とその子要素、孫要素のインスタンスも全て解除します。


使い方

  1. "Detach Instance（インスタンスの切り離し）"したい要素を全て選択します。
  2. 本プラグインを実行します。


注意

  • コンポーネントは解除できません。
  • Figma上で下記の操作を行った場合と同じ動作を行います。
  1. Ctrl + Alt + B / Option + Command + B （"Detach Instance（インスタンスの切り離し）"）
  2. Enter （子要素を全て選択）
  3. Ctrl + Alt + B / Option + Command + B（"Detach Instance（インスタンスの切り離し）"）

　　…
plugins.tagline: Detach all instances in the selected objects.

plugins.name: What's your name?
plugins.description:
You're sick of using imaginary people in your designs with names like "John Doe"? So am I! I wanted a name generator that uses names from all over the world.


  • No selection: Generate name in new text node
  • Text node selection: replace existing text


Limitations

Currently there are some limitations in there are only chosen countries, only 5 names per country and there also may be bugs in the plugin overall. But I'm happy to improve!

Furthermore, I am aware that I do not address all people with the gender "male" and "female". A third option is being planned but I'm not sure yet how to implement it exactly, whether all languages can reflect it.


Data

The dataset of names was created with the help of an AI, so it may well contain errors. Please feel free to let me know! Also do you miss some specific country?

accepted.name: Franni
accepted.description:
Design System Designer |
BSc in Computer Science & MSc in Media Informatics.

Loving space operas, art and riding my bike. Part of the LGBTQIA+ community.

plugins.tagline: A simple name generator for people from all over the world

plugins.name: Design Board
plugins.description:
What

Interior designers use 3D/2D elevation renderings with callouts to specific design materials used. It's tedious to add the layout and then add the callouts, while keeping track of what materials are being used for specific clients.


How

Design board provides a way to simplify this workflow.

  1. Sync master list of items from google sheets
  2. Add/update/delete items from plugin (keeps sheet in sync)
  3. Choose items to add to layout
  4. Save active items back to sheets


Get started

  1. Clone the sheets template from sample sheet. The spreadsheet needs to have sheets named master and active to read/write items.
  2. Use https://designboard.destinationeichler.com/ to login and get credentials for google sheets access
  3. Login to plugin using the credentials and view your master items.
  4. Use a card template from this sample figma design. The elements in the template card need to be named as name, desc, qty-val, price-val, cost-val, img


NOTE - If you don't want to set up a sheet, use mock as the token name and the plugin will load with some test data.


Contact

Reach out to the team for bug fixes, feature requests use this form.
plugins.tagline: Integrate Google sheets with Figma for common Interior design workflows

plugins.name: Stretch — by ‹div›RIOTS
plugins.description:
You thought native stretching and transform was impossible in Figma ? think again.


Stretch applies a scaled transformation to Figma layers stored in your clipboard, so you can paste them back on your canvas fully scaled (and still editable).


What can you stretch?

  1. Text layers
  2. Vectors
  3. Entire frames


How it works:

  1. Copy the layer(s) to your clipboard (CTRL+C / ⌘+C)
  2. Paste your layer in the plugin (if in the browser, you'll have to hit CTRL+V / ⌘+V afterwards, as the plugin can't access the clipboard automatically).
  3. Select the axis and factor you want for the transformation.
  4. Click Stretch to clipboard
  5. Paste the transformed layer back onto your canvas


Enjoy a fully-stretched layer that’s 100% editable!


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‹div›RIOTS

💬 Chat with us

------------------------------

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.name: Quaaant — Sync Design & Dev
plugins.description:
Automate DesignOps


➡️ Handoff your assets, components, and tokens to devs.

➡️ Keep them in sync across your product team and tools.

➡️ Connect design, prototyping, and development with one click.


With Quaaant there’s no more manually exporting, importing, or redoing everything with every change.


How to use Quaaant?


➡️ Create and link assets: Designers can create assets directly in Figma or use Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, then easily link them into Figma, all within the Quaaant platform.

➡️ Build components and create tokens: Use assets to build components, assign variables to them, and create design tokens in Figma, all while keeping everything in sync with Quaaant.

➡️ Handoff and iterate: Developers can pull assets from Adobe or Figma and use components and tokens from Figma, with Quaaant automating the sync into their development environments.


Integrations


Quaaant integrates with design and development platforms like Figma, Adobe, WordPress, and JavaScript, making it easier to move assets between different phases of product development.


⤴️ Supported source integrations: Figma, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop.

⤵️ Supported destinations: Figma, JavaScript, React, Vue.js, Angular, Svelte, Next.js, Nuxt.js, Electron, Gutenberg, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery, Beaver Builder, iOS (Swift, Objective-C), Android (Java, Kotlin, Dart, Flutter), Unity, C#, C++, Go, PHP, Laravel, Python.
plugins.tagline: Automate DesignOps: Handoff assets, components, and tokens, and keep them in sync.

➡️ Connect design, prototyping, and development with one click.


With Quaaant there’s no more manually exporting, importing, or redoing everything with every change.


How to use Quaaant?


➡️ Create and link assets: Designers can create assets directly in Figma or use Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, then easily link them into Figma, all within the Quaaant platform.

➡️ Build components and create tokens: Use assets to build components, assign variables to them, and create design tokens in Figma, all while keeping everything in sync with Quaaant.

➡️ Handoff and iterate: Developers can pull assets from Adobe or Figma and use components and tokens from Figma, with Quaaant automating the sync into their development environments.


Integrations


Quaaant integrates with design and development platforms like Figma, Adobe, WordPress, and JavaScript, making it easier to move assets between different phases of product development.


⤴️ Supported source integrations: Figma, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop.

⤵️ Supported destinations: Figma, JavaScript, React, Vue.js, Angular, Svelte, Next.js, Nuxt.js, Electron, Gutenberg, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery, Beaver Builder, iOS (Swift, Objective-C), Android (Java, Kotlin, Dart, Flutter), Unity, C#, C++, Go, PHP, Laravel, Python.
88184.release_notes: 🔧 Overall performance enhancements and bug fixes
88184.tagline: Automate DesignOps: Handoff assets, components, and tokens, and keep them in sync.

plugins.name: Конструктор иконок для разделов
plugins.description:
Как создать иконки


1. Зайдите в свой аккаунт Figma (кнопка Log in в правом верхнем углу) или создайте новый (Sign up).

2. Нажмите голубую кнопку Open in… → New file.

3. В появившемся окне нажмите Run, чтобы запустить плагин.

4. Добавьте одну или несколько квадратных картинок.

5. Выберите нужную форму иконок — круглую или квадратную. 

6. Нажмите «Сохранить». Готово, иконки появятся в папке «Загрузки».

plugins.name: Color Blender : Tints Generator
plugins.description:
Color Blender allows designers to effortlessly generate a variety of color tints based on a selected color. With customizable options for tint count, ellipse size, layout direction, and item spacing, this plugin empowers you to quickly explore and experiment with different color variations that will help you creating your style guide or design system foundation and enhance your design workflow by creating stunning tints in just a few clicks.


Instructions

  1. To get started run the plugin and use the color picker to choose the base color for generating tints.
  2. Optional: You can enter a name for the color, or leave it as the default "Primary".
  3. Optional: Set the desired number of tints to be generated. By default, 10 tints will be created.
  4. Optional: Modify the size of the ellipse shapes that represent the tints. The default size is 120 pixels.
  5. Choose the layout direction: Select whether the tints should be arranged horizontally or vertically.
  6. Optional: Adjust the spacing between the tints to control their visual arrangement. The default spacing is set to 32 pixels.
  7. Click "Create Tints": Generate the tints based on the selected color and configuration settings.


With ColorBlender, you can effortlessly create and explore a range of color tints, unlocking new possibilities for your design projects. Enjoy the flexibility and efficiency of generating beautiful color variations with just a few simple steps.


How to reach out and support

Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/desmismail/

Email: desmismail@gmail.com

Website: mohamed-ismail.com

plugins.name: (Free) FigJam Dark Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin creates a black transparent background that is bigger than your Figjam board. It is then locked so you can work regularly on-top of it, simulating a dark mode background.


Note: If your content appears behind the dark mode effect, please right-click your content and 'Move to front'!


To remove this effect, you can do any one of the following:

  1. Use 'Undo' (Cmd+Z / Ctrl+Z).
  2. Unlock and delete the large background shapes created by the plugin.
  3. Restore your file using Version History (before the plugin was applied).


This plugin is open-source. Contributions are welcome!

https://github.com/Connagh/figjam-dark-mode/
plugins.tagline: Add a dark background to your FigJam boards!

plugins.name: SVG to React / Native / SolidJS
plugins.description:
SVG to React / Native / SolidJS

A Figma plugin that lets you easily optimize and transform multiple SVG files into JSX components.


Features

  1. Optimizes and transforms SVGs into framework-specific components for [React](https://react.dev/), [React Native](https://reactnative.dev/), and [SolidJS](https://www.solidjs.com/)
  2. Utilizes [SVGO](https://svgo.dev/) to optimize SVGs
  3. Formats code using [Prettier](https://prettier.io/)
  4. Allows batch transformation of multiple SVGs at once
  5. Provides various options for SVG transformation


Usage

  1. Select at least one node (any item that figma can export).
  2. Run the "SVG to React/Native/SolidJS" plugin.
  3. Open the tab for your desired framework (default: React).
  4. Adjust options to your preference.
  5. Save all SVGs as files" or open individual SVGs to copy/save.


Inspired by

  1. SaraVieira/svg-to-jsx
  2. gregberge/svgr
  3. svg/svgo


Github Repo
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that lets you easily optimize and transform multiple SVG files into JSX components

plugins.name: Lissajous Curves
plugins.description:
Lissajous curves, named after the French mathematician Jules Antoine Lissajous, are mathematical visualizations that represent the motion of two perpendicular harmonic oscillations. These curves are formed by plotting the coordinates of points that correspond to the simultaneous values of the two oscillating variables.


The shape and pattern of a Lissajous curve depend on the relative frequencies, phases, and amplitudes of the two oscillations. By adjusting these parameters, a wide variety of visually captivating curves can be generated. Lissajous curves can exhibit symmetric or asymmetric patterns, including ellipses, circles, straight lines, and more intricate looped or spiraling designs.


Lissajous curves have applications in various fields, including mathematics, physics, engineering, and art. They are used for visualizations, harmonic analysis, signal processing, and even in graphical representations of sound waves. In the world of design, Lissajous curves offer an aesthetically pleasing and intriguing element that can be incorporated into logos, backgrounds, illustrations, and other creative projects.


Plugin details:


  • a: This is the frequency of oscillation along the x-axis for the Lissajous curve. The value of 'a' influences the shape and complexity of the curve, determining how many 'loops' it forms in the horizontal direction.


  • b: Similar to 'a', 'b' is the frequency of oscillation along the y-axis. It determines how many 'loops' the curve forms in the vertical direction.


  • delta: This is the phase shift between the two sinusoidal functions that generate the Lissajous curve. By altering the value of 'delta', you can change the relative positions of the curves in the x and y directions, leading to a wide variety of different shapes.


  • numPoints: This is the number of data points used to draw the Lissajous curve. It's effectively the resolution of the curve; a larger number of points will result in a smoother curve, while fewer points will create a more 'stepped' or polygonal appearance.


  • scale: This is a scaling factor that influences the overall size of the Lissajous curve. By adjusting 'scale', you can make the curve larger or smaller without changing its basic shape.

accepted.name: zchry
accepted.description: Zachary

plugins.tagline: Quickly create Lissajous curves for your design projects.

plugins.name: AI Content Filler
plugins.description:
AI Content Filler is a content generation plugin based on GPT and DALL·E. It uses layer names as prompts to generate text or images. Simply name the layers appropriately, then select multiple layers to generate content with a single click. You can also use grouping to ensure consistency of the generated content.


Features

  • Layer names as prompts: Generate any type of content and customize the format, length, style, etc.
  • Quick generation: Generate multiple texts and images with one click.
  • Context grouping: Ensure consistency of the generated texts and images.
  • Free to use: Use your own OpenAI API Key without additional charges.


How to use

  • (1) Input your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one yet, you can get one from https://platform.openai.com.
  • (2) Rename the layer or group to which you want to apply the AI-generated content, starting with [ai]. For example,
 + Frame: [ai] user profile
 | - Shape: [ai] avatar photo
 | - Text:  [ai] username, at least 4 characters
 | - Text:  [ai] email address
  • (3) Select one or multiple renamed layers or groups.
  • (4) Click the "Generate and Fill" button at the bottom of the plugin panel.


Remember to experiment and explore the capabilities of the AI Content Filler plugin to maximize its potential and streamline your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Generate and Fill multiple texts and image in one click

plugins.name: Is it done yet?
plugins.description:
Is It Done Yet? is a simple plugin that enables you to organize frames according to their progress status by adding a tag alongside each name. It also allows you to add a ticket number for further organization.

1) For designers - Quickly communicate the status of their designs and make it easier to mark designs for review and hand over files for development.

2) For developers - Clearly marked files that they can work on, leaving no room for confusion or error.

3) For PM's - know what’s ready to groom

4) For Clients - Reduce confusion and save time on turn-around by letting them know precisely what’s ready for approval

plugins.name: Visual Difference
plugins.description:
Compare snapshots of Figma objects to visually compare later as those objects change.


This Figma plug enables you to add and manage snapshots per Figma page using the Visual Difference dialog. Per comparison, you can:


  • Compare baseline and latest versions side by side
  • Quickly switch between the comparison and the original artwork to adjust
  • Quickly visualize which snapshots have differences and which do not
  • Identify when the snapshot was taken and the last time comparisons were run
  • Highlight differences by a scalably transparent overlay or fun party mode
  • Approve of detected differences to replace a baseline snapshot


Building upon how Figma enables you to compare visual differences in a branch of the main file, you can use this plugin to:


  • Conduct visual regression prior to or independent of Figma branching
  • Run comparisons for single objects independently
  • Detect differences caused by updating library assets
  • Inspect and adjust objects rapidly while comparing
  • Discover subtle differences in page mockups


Made by @kevinmpowell and @nathanacurtis of EightShapes LLC.

plugins.name: Trello for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your Trello board directly into Figma


Dynamic elements and "drag and drop" included.


Get started with these three easy steps:

  1. Click the link in the plugin to authorise your Trello account and get an authorisation Token.
  2. Paste the token in the Authorisation token field.
  3. Enter the name of the Trello board you want to import in the board name field. Note: the name of the board must be exact, including spacing and spelling.


The plugin is open source, check out the code here:

https://github.com/thomasbrettell/trello-for-figma-plugin


This is an unofficial Trello plugin, not affiliated with Atlassian
